name: Congruent number
rephrased: A congruent number is a positive integer that can be expressed as the area of a right-angled triangle with three rational number sides.
implication_form: If a positive integer n can be expressed as the area of a rational-sided right-angled triangle, then n is a congruent number.
posed_by: Euler (popularized, though the problem is ancient)
explained: A positive integer n is congruent if and only if there exists a right-angled triangle with rational side lengths whose area is equal to n.
